ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Or do they say, 'We are an assembly who will win'?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Or do they say: "We are a well-accoutred army?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Or do they say: “We are a strong legion, strong enough for victory?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Do they say, "We shall be victorious because we are united?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Or they say, “We shall all take revenge as a group.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Or say they: "We are a great multitude, victorious"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Or do they say: We are a host allied together to help each other?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Or do they say, 'We are a congregation that shall be succoured?'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Or say they: We are a host victorious?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Or do they say, "We are a united group, and we are bound to prevail?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Or is it that they say: we are a multitude prevailing!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Do they say, ‘We are a confederate league’?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Or do they say: "We acting together can defend ourselves"?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Or do they say: "We are a great multitude, and we shall be victorious?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Or do they say: 'We are a gathering that will be victorious'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Or do they say, “We are united, and we will be victorious”?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Or do they say, "We are an assembly supporting [each other]"?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [54:44] Or do they, the disbelievers of Quraysh, say: ‘We are a host that will be helped to victory’?, against Muhammad (s)? When Abū Jahl, on the day of Badr, said: ‘We are a host that will be helped to victory’, the following was revealed:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Or say they) i.e. the disbelievers of Mecca: (We are a host victorious) and immune from punishment?
